info.name: Graphman pi31.4
info.description:
# Graphman API Collection

- version 1.0
    

Use this collection to discover the graphman API, to capture your relevant gateway configuration, to prepare your migration workflow

## Set your graphman target

The collection has variables for pointing to your graphman endpoints. You can define separate targets for a source and a target gateway.

## Set your gateway

You can change the admin username/password in the Authorization tab of the collection root as well

request.description:
# Graph Bundle All

This gets all configuration entities in one graphman query.

# Apply Bundle Template

This is a generic apply template mutation. It takes a graphman bundle as input. That bundle is a variable that was set by a Create bundle request prior to this one.

request.description:
# Policy and dependencies bundle

This graphman query retrieves a policy and all its dependencies (including nested dependencies).

The script in Tests (running post-request) produces an applicable bundle from the graphman response. This bundle is persisted in an environment variable.

Input:

See Body, GraphQL Variables. Set name: the name of the policy you want to package with its dependencies.

# Apply bundle

Applies the bundle that is recorded in the environment variable by the previous call (Create Bundle). Make sure you are using the same postman environment between those two calls.

This graphman queries retrieves all services and policies in a folder and its subfolders.

# Apply bundle

Applies the bundle that is recorded in the environment variable by the previous call (Create Bundle). Make sure you are using the same postman environment between those two calls.

graphql.query:
query serviceWithDependencies ($resolutionPath: String!) {
    webApiServiceByResolutionPath (resolutionPath: $resolutionPath) {
        name
        checksum
        resolutionPath
        folderPath
        policy {
            xml
            allDependencies {
              policyFragments {
                    name
                    checksum
                    folderPath
                    guid
                    policy {
                        xml
                    }
                }
                encassConfigs {
                    name
                    checksum
                    policyName
                    guid
                    encassArgs {
                        name
                        type
                        ordinal
                        guiLabel
                        guiPrompt
                    }
                    encassResults {
                        name
                        type
                    }
                }
                trustedCerts {
                    name
                    checksum
                    certBase64
                    verifyHostname
                    trustAnchor
                    trustedFor
                    revocationCheckPolicyType
                }
                clusterProperties {
                    name
                    checksum
                    value
                }
                jdbcConnections {
                    name
                    checksum
                    driverClass
                    jdbcUrl
                    enabled
                    username
                    password
                    minPoolSize
                    maxPoolSize
                    properties {
                        name
                        value
                    }
                }
                schemas {
                    systemId
                    checksum
                    targetNs
                    description
                    content
                }
                dtds {
                    systemId
                    checksum
                    publicId
                    description
                    content
                }
                fips {
                    name
                    checksum
                    goid
                    enableCredentialTypeX509
                    enableCredentialTypeSaml
                    certificateReferences {
                        thumbprintSha1
                    }
                }
                ldaps {
                    name
                    goid
                    ldapUrls
                    ldapsClientAuthEnabled
                    ldapsClientKeyAlias
                    searchBase
                    writable
                    bindDn
                    bindPassword
                    userMappings {
                        objClass
                        nameAttrName
                        loginAttrName
                        passwdAttrName
                        firstNameAttrName
                        lastNameAttrName
                        emailNameAttrName
                        kerberosAttrName
                        kerberosEnterpriseAttrName
                        userCertAttrName
                        passwdType {
                            val
                        }
                    }
                    groupMappings {
                        objClass
                        nameAttrName
                        memberAttrName
                        memberStrategy {
                            val
                        }
                    }
                    checksum
                }
                internalGroups {
                    name
                    checksum
                    goid
                    description
                }
                fipGroups {
                    name
                    providerName
                    checksum
                    goid
                    description
                }
                internalUsers {
                    name
                    goid
                    checksum
                    memberOf {
                        name
                    }
                    login
                    password
                    firstName
                    lastName
                    email
                    certBase64
                }
                fipUsers {
                    name
                    providerName
                    checksum
                    goid
                    subjectDn
                    memberOf {
                        name
                    }
                    login
                    firstName
                    lastName
                    email
                    certBase64
                }
                keys {
                    alias
                    checksum
                    goid
                    p12
                }
                secrets {
                    name
                    secretType
                    checksum
                    goid
                    variableReferencable
                    secret
                    description
                }
                cassandraConnections {
                    goid
                    name
                    keyspace
                    contactPoints
                    port
                    username
                    securePasswordName
                    sslEnabled
                    cipherSuites
                    properties {
                        name
                        value
                    }
                    checksum
                }
                jmsDestinations {
                    goid
                    connectionGoid
                    name
                    direction
                    providerType
                    initialContextFactoryClassname
                    connectionFactoryName
                    jndiUrl
                    jndiUsername
                    jndiPassword
                    template
                    enabled
                    jndiSslDetails {
                        sslEnabled
                        sslForAuthenticationOnly
                        sslVerifyServerCertificate
                        sslVerifyServerHostname
                        sslClientKeyAlias
                    }
                    destinationType
                    destinationName
                    destinationUsername
                    destinationPassword
                    destinationSslDetails {
                        sslEnabled
                        sslForAuthenticationOnly
                        sslVerifyServerCertificate
                        sslVerifyServerHostname
                        sslClientKeyAlias
                    }
                    template
                    enabled
                    properties {
                        name
                        value
                    }
                    checksum
                }
            }
        }
        enabled
        methodsAllowed
    }
}

item.description:
# Bundles and Migration

This folder contains the creation and application of configuration bundles that are created according to different bundling strategies:

1.  a service bundled with all its dependencies
2.  services and policies in a folder and all its sub-folders
3.  a policy bundled with all its dependencies

graphql.query:
query cassandraConnections {
    cassandraConnections {
        goid 
        name 
        checksum 
        
        enabled 
        keyspace 
        contactPoints 
        port 
        compression 
        username 
        securePasswordName 
        sslEnabled 
        cipherSuites 
        properties { name value }
    }
}

request.description: # Retrieve All Cassandra Connections

graphql.query:
query cassandraConnectionByName($name: String!) {
    cassandraConnectionByName(name: $name) {
        goid 
        name 
        checksum 
        
        enabled 
        keyspace 
        contactPoints 
        port 
        compression 
        username 
        securePasswordName 
        sslEnabled 
        cipherSuites 
        properties { name value }
    }
}

request.description: # Retrieve Cassandra Connection By Name

# Set Cluster Properties

Set or update existing cluster properties.

Input: an array of cluster properties

``` json
{  "input": [{    "name": "passthroughGrpcHost",    "value": "https://grpc.apis.corp.dev:7843",    "description" : "a cwp description"  }]}

```

# Delete Cluster Property

Delete a cluster property given its name.

Input: name

# All Cluster Properties

Get the list of cluster properties.

Input: no input

# Cluster Property by Name

Get the cluster property with the given name

Input: name

# Get all Policy Framents

Get all the policy fragments

Input: no input

# Policy Fragment by Name

Get a policy given its name

Input: name

# Policy Fragment by Name

Get a policy given its name

Input: name

# Policy and its dependencies

Retrieve a policy fragment and all of its dependencies

Input: name (the name of the policy fragment)

# Policy fragments in a folder

Query the policy fragments in a folder. This goes through all the subfolders (nested) as well.

Input: folderPath

# Policy fragment by guid

Get a policy fragment given its guid (if there is such a policy).

Input: guid

graphql.variables:
{
  "input": {
    "name" : "New test policy",
    "folderPath" : "/migrationTest",
    "policy" : {
      "xml" : "<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<wsp:Policy xmlns:L7p="http://www.layer7tech.com/ws/policy" xmlns:wsp="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2002/12/policy">
    <wsp:All wsp:Usage="Required">
        <L7p:CommentAssertion>
            <L7p:Comment stringValue="Policy Fragment: dep3"/>
        </L7p:CommentAssertion>
        <L7p:SetVariable>
            <L7p:Base64Expression stringValue="c2d3ZGZk"/>
            <L7p:VariableToSet stringValue="ksjdhfkdsjhk"/>
        </L7p:SetVariable>
    </wsp:All>
</wsp:Policy>
"
    }
  }
}

request.description:
# Delete Policy Fragment

Delete a policy fragment given its name.

Input: name

# Update Policy Fragment

This mutation lets you change an existing policy fragment given its name. If no policy fragment with that name exists on target, this will fail.

Input: in this sample we are changing the folder location of an existing policy given the policy name.

``` json
{  "name" : "New policy somewhere",  "input": {    "folderPath" : "/migrationTest"  }}

```

      </s:complexType>

Create multiple web API services on the target gateway.

Input: See sample for input. Here is a sample:

``` json
{  "input": {    "name" : "New service created",    "folderPath" : "/migrationTest",    "resolutionPath": "/testNewService17",            "methodsAllowed": [                "GET",                "POST",                "PUT",                "DELETE"            ],            "enabled": true,            "policy": {                "xml": "wsp:Policy..."            }  }}

```

# Delete Web Api Service

Deletes a Web Api Service given its resolution path.

Input: resolutionPath

# APIs in a folder

Retrieves the Web APi Services given a folder path. This query good into subfolders as well so you get the whole tree.

Input: folderPath

item.name: Web API Service by Resolution Path

request.description:
# API by resolution path

Get a Web API Service given its unique resolution path.

Input: resolutionPath

item.name: Web API Services by Name including Policy Dependencies

request.description:

List all of the services

Input: no input

request.description:
# All Trusted Certs

word

# Certs by subject DN

Retrieves a list of trusted certificates with the matching subject distinguished name.

Input: subjectDn

# Cert by thumbprint

Retrieves the unique (if any) certificate given its thumbprint sha1.

Input: thumbprintSha1

# Create Certificate

Creates new trusted certificate.

Input: see sample

``` json
{  "input": {    "name" : "New trusted cert",    "certBase64" : "thebase64cert",    "verifyHostname" : true,    "trustAnchor" : true,    "trustedFor" : ["SIGNING_SERVER_CERTS"],    "revocationCheckPolicyType" : "USE_DEFAULT"  }}

```

# Update Trusted Certificate

Update an existing certificate. Will fail if certificate does not already exist on target.

Input: this sample changes the name, trustedFor, and revocation settings of the certificate identified by the thumbprint value

``` json
{  "input": {     "thumbprintSha1": "iZJ/xtwDDv+gic0J9idwO9XqYVw=",     "name" : "The Certinator",     "trustedFor" : ["SSL", "SIGNING_SERVER_CERTS"],     "revocationCheckPolicyType" : "NONE"  }}

```

# Delete Trusted Certificate

Delete the trusted certificate given its thumbprintsha1

Input: thumbprintSha1

# Set Certificates

Set or update multiple trusted certificate altogether.

Input: see sample

``` json
{  "input": {    "name" : "New trusted cert",    "certBase64" : "thebase64cert",    "verifyHostname" : true,    "trustAnchor" : true,    "trustedFor" : ["SIGNING_SERVER_CERTS"],    "revocationCheckPolicyType" : "USE_DEFAULT"  }}

```

# All Encass Configs

Get all encass configs

Input: none

# Encass Config by name

Get the encapsulated assertion configuration by its name.

Input: name

# Encass Config by Guid

Get the encapsulated assertion configuration by its guid.

Input: guid

# Create Encass Config

Create a new encass config. An encass config with the same name cannot exist on target. Assumes the policy is already present on target but can otherwise be combined in a bundled mutation.

Input: sample input below:

``` json
{  "input": {            "name": "combinevar2",            "policyName": "combinevar",                        "encassArgs": [                {                    "name": "a",                    "type": "STRING",                    "ordinal": 1,                    "guiLabel": "a",                    "guiPrompt": true                },                {                    "name": "b",                    "type": "STRING",                    "ordinal": 2,                    "guiLabel": "b",                    "guiPrompt": true                }            ],            "encassResults": [                {                    "name": "combo",                    "type": "STRING"                }            ]        }}

```

# Update Encass Config

Updates an existing encapsulated assertion configuration. If the encass does not already exists, this will fail.

Input: the name of the encass to update and what to update. see sample:

``` json
{    "name":"combinevar2",    "input": {            "encassResults": [                {                    "name": "combo",                    "type": "STRING"                },                {                    "name": "added",                    "type": "STRING"                }            ]        }}
```

# Delete Encass Config

Deletes an encass config given its name

Input: name

# Set Encass Configs

Set multiple encass configs altogether.

An encass config with the same name cannot exist on target. Assumes the policy is already present on target but can otherwise be combined in a bundled mutation.

Input: sample input below:

``` json
{  "input": {            "name": "combinevar2",            "policyName": "combinevar",                        "encassArgs": [                {                    "name": "a",                    "type": "STRING",                    "ordinal": 1,                    "guiLabel": "a",                    "guiPrompt": true                },                {                    "name": "b",                    "type": "STRING",                    "ordinal": 2,                    "guiLabel": "b",                    "guiPrompt": true                }            ],            "encassResults": [                {                    "name": "combo",                    "type": "STRING"                }            ]        }}

```

# All JDBC Connections

Get the list of JDBC Connections.

Input: no input

# JDBC Connections by Name

Get the list of JDBC Connections by Name.

# Create JDBC Connection

request.description:
# Get all Secrets

Get all the secrets

These secrets are used by gateway policies also for example by jdbc connection configurations

Base64 encrypted secret. The encryption is compatible with openssl secret encryption using cypher AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding. You can decrypt these values at command line using this command:

```
> echo  | openssl enc -d -aes-256-cbc -md sha256 -pass pass: -a
"""

```

# Get secret by name

Get secret by name

These secrets are used by gateway policies also for example by jdbc connection configurations

Base64 encrypted secret. The encryption is compatible with openssl secret encryption using cypher AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding. You can decrypt these values at command line using this command:

```
> echo  | openssl enc -d -aes-256-cbc -md sha256 -pass pass: -a
"""

```

# Get all Keys

Get all keys.

This is an entry in the gateway keystore. These entries combine a private key and associated certificate and are used for example by listener ports.

These represent the gateway's own certificates as opposed to the Certificate type which represent a cert trusted by the gateway.

Base64 encoded PKCS12 keystore containing the private key and cert chain for the key entry.  
The keystore is password-protected using the transaction encryption passphrase provided.

# Get key by alias

Get key by alias.

This is an entry in the gateway keystore. These entries combine a private key and associated certificate and are used for example by listener ports.

These represent the gateway's own certificates as opposed to the Certificate type which represent a cert trusted by the gateway.

Base64 encoded PKCS12 keystore containing the private key and cert chain for the key entry.  
The keystore is password-protected using the transaction encryption passphrase provided.

# **Set Secrets**

These secrets are used by gateway policies also for example by jdbc connection configurations

Base64 encrypted secret. The encryption is compatible with openssl secret encryption using cypher AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding. You can decrypt these values at command line using this command:

```
> echo  | openssl enc -d -aes-256-cbc -md sha256 -pass pass: -a
"""

```

# Set Keys

Base64 encoded PKCS12 keystore containing the private key and cert chain for the key entry.  
The keystore is password-protected using the transaction encryption passphrase provided.

graphql.query:
query jmsDestinations {
    jmsDestinations {
        goid
        connectionGoid
        name
        direction
        providerType
        initialContextFactoryClassname
        connectionFactoryName
        
        jndiUrl
        jndiUsername
        jndiPassword
        
        template
        enabled
        jndiSslDetails {
            sslEnabled
            sslForAuthenticationOnly
            sslVerifyServerCertificate
            sslVerifyServerHostname
            sslClientKeyAlias
        }
        
        destinationType
        destinationName
        destinationUsername
        destinationPassword
        destinationSslDetails {
            sslEnabled
            sslForAuthenticationOnly
            sslVerifyServerCertificate
            sslVerifyServerHostname
            sslClientKeyAlias
        }
        
        template
        enabled
        
        properties {
            name
            value
        }

        checksum
    }
}

graphql.query:
query smConfigs {
    smConfigs {
        name
        goid
        enabled
        agentHost
        agentIP
        agentSecret
        agentHostConfig
        cryptoMode
        ipCheckEnabled
        updateSSOToken
        clusterFailoverThreshold
        nonClusterFailover
        username
        securePasswordName
        properties {
            name
            value
        }
        checksum
    }
}

        ipCheckEnabled
        updateSSOToken
        clusterFailoverThreshold
        nonClusterFailover
        username
        securePasswordName
        properties {
            name
            value
        }
        checksum
    }
}

item.description:
This generates a identity provider summary for a source and target gateway and produces a report summarizing which entities on source are not present on target as well as creates a list of goid mappings. The entity types covered by this are:

\*   Fip
\*   LdapConfig
\*   FipGroup
\*   FipUser
\*   InternalGroup
\*   InternalUser
